meanings.definition: Walk or move at a slow, relaxed pace.
meanings.sent1: The horse was ambling along the trail.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys ambling through the park on sunny days.
meanings.sent3: The sloth was ambling so slowly that even the snail passed it.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be ambling along lazily, just like the old man on his evening walk.
meanings.sent5: The river ambling through the valley painted a peaceful scene.

meanings.sent1: We went for an ambling after-dinner walk.
meanings.sent2: The ambling along the beach was refreshing.
meanings.sent3: The ambling of the tourists in the city center created a pleasant buzz.
meanings.sent4: His mind took an ambling through memories of childhood summers.
meanings.sent5: The gentle ambling of the stream was a soothing background sound.
